FuncDef:
The map flow-queue command sets the mapping between the CoS of the flow queue to the CoS of the class queue.
The undo map flow-queue command removes the setting.
By default, the mapping between the flow queue and class queue is the one-to-one mapping.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the CoS value of the queue.
The value can be ef, af1, af2, af3, af4, be, cs6, or cs7.

Examples: [*HUAWEI-flow-mapping-test] map flow-queue af2 to port-queue ef
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The map flow-queue command configures mapping from eight FQ priorities to eight CQ priorities (BE, AF1, AF2, AF3, AF4, EF, CS6, and CS7) to allow a service in FQ to enter the specific queue in a CQ.
If traffic of two user queues are output through one interface, 16 flows of the two users will aggregate to eight queues on a port. If the priority of user A is higher than that of user B, different flow mappings can be specified for users A and B respectively to allow traffic of user A to enter high-priority queues on the port. This ensures that services of users A and B are distinguished and scheduled differently.
Configuration Impact
If no data is configured with the map flow-queue command, the default setting is adopted, which means that the one-to-one mapping between the flow queue and class queue is adopted.
